intro: Erigeron piperianus, commonly known as the roughleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers from summer to fall. Erigeron piperianus is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ecological value.
